etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin poetria, from Latin poeta ‘poet’. In early use the word sometimes referred to creative literature in general

definitions: literary work in which special intensity is given to the expression of feelings and ideas by the use of distinctive style and rhythm; poems collectively or as a genre of literature

examples.text: he is chiefly famous for his love poetry

shortDefinitions: literary work in which expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by use of distinctive style and rhythm

definitions: a quality of beauty and intensity of emotion regarded as characteristic of poems

examples.text: poetry and fire are nicely balanced in the music

shortDefinitions: quality of beauty and intensity of emotion regarded as characteristic of poems

definitions: something regarded as comparable to poetry in its beauty

examples.text: the music department is housed in a building that is pure poetry

shortDefinitions: something regarded as comparable to poetry in its beauty
